column3: This will be removed anyway when we bump glibc for the 0.22 release? If yes, might as well not touch the code for now and do the wholesale removal on Nov 1st

> This will be removed anyway when we bump glibc for the 0.22 release? If yes, might as well not touch the code for now and do the wholesale removal on Nov 1st\n\nIn #16684 I failed to find a consensus about bumping glibc.

Please do not break build compatibility with 32-bit x86. Yes, we no longer distribute binaries for it, but I think it's OK if people build their own binaries for it! (and I think we promised as such, to not break compatibility with 32-bit x86 for self-builders)

The removed code was used for shipped binaries only. People always can
build their own binaries dynamically linked to system libs, no?

On Mon, 17 Aug 2020 at 13:01, Wladimir J. van der Laan <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

>
>
> Please do not break build compatibility with 32-bit x86. Yes, we no longer
> distribute binaries for it, but I think it's OK if people build their own
> bina
Sure, I guess it's okay in this case, I just meant it in general, this is not the kind of PR I'd like to encourage.
